Utterance: Hi there! It’s good to see you again. How has your week been?
Hi, Ellie! It’s been pretty good. I actually started taking walks like we talked about!
That’s fantastic! How did it feel to incorporate that into your routine?
It felt really nice! I’ve been going for short walks after work, and it helps clear my mind.
That’s wonderful to hear! Exercise can be such a great way to relieve stress. Have you noticed any changes in your mood or energy levels?
Yeah, I feel a bit more energized, and it’s nice to have that time to myself.
I’m glad to hear that! You also mentioned wanting to improve your sleep routine. How has that been going?
I’ve been trying to stick to a schedule, and I think it’s helping. I feel like I’m sleeping a bit better.
That’s great progress! Consistency can make a big difference. What time have you been going to bed?
I’ve been aiming for around 10:30, which is earlier than I was before.
That’s a great goal! How do you feel about your overall stress levels this week?
I think they’ve gone down a bit. I feel more in control now that I’m taking those walks and getting better sleep.
That’s excellent! It sounds like you’re making positive changes. Have you been able to keep up with your studies as well?
I’ve been studying a bit more too. I’m still struggling with motivation, but I’m trying to set small goals.
Setting small, achievable goals is a great strategy. What kind of goals have you set for yourself?
I’ve been trying to study for at least 30 minutes a day instead of cramming all at once.
That’s a smart approach! It can make studying feel less overwhelming. Have you found any specific topics or areas of psychology that interest you more?
I’ve been really interested in counseling techniques lately. I like the idea of helping people work through their issues.
That’s a valuable area to explore. Have you thought about any specific techniques or methods that resonate with you?
I’ve been reading about active listening and empathy, and I think those are really important.
Absolutely! Those skills are crucial in counseling. Have you had any opportunities to practice those skills in your volunteer work?
Yes, actually! I’ve been trying to use active listening with the people I interact with, and it feels good to connect with them.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re applying what you’re learning in real-life situations. Is there anything else you’d like to focus on today?
I guess I’m just curious about how to handle stress better when it comes up unexpectedly.
That’s a great topic. What kinds of situations tend to cause you stress?
I think when I have deadlines for school or work. It can feel overwhelming sometimes.
It’s common to feel that way during busy times. Have you tried any techniques to manage stress in those moments?
I’ve tried deep breathing, but I sometimes forget to do it when I’m really stressed.
It can be hard to remember those techniques in the heat of the moment. Would it help to set reminders or practice them when you’re not feeling stressed?
Yeah, I think that would be helpful. I want to make it a habit.
That’s a great idea! Let’s make that a goal for the week. How about setting a reminder on your phone to practice deep breathing daily?
I can do that! I’ll try to make it part of my walk routine.
Perfect! I’m looking forward to hearing how that goes. Is there anything else on your mind today?
No, I think that’s it for now. Thank you for all your help!
You’re very welcome! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. See you next time!
Bye, Ellie!
Goodbye!
